title: Introduction to MongoDB
course_info:
About this course: This course will get you up and running with MongoDB quickly, and teach you how to leverage its power for data analytics.

We'll start by mastering the fundamentals of MongoDB, including MongoDB’s Document data model, importing data into a cluster, working with our CRUD API and Aggregation Framework. These topics will be taught through a demo application which will give you a great first encounter of how simple and practical it can be to build applications with MongoDB.

In addition to these essential topics, you will also learn and work with useful MongoDB tools and services. You will work with Atlas, MongoDB's database as a service, MongoDB Compass, a schema visualization tool, as well as many other useful command-line utilities.
target_audience: Who is this class for: This course has been primarily designed for learners who have prior experience as a data analyst or data scientist. You should already have experience with Python and Jupyter Notebooks.

week_data.title: Week 1
video: Using Compass to View Data in an Atlas Cluster
Using Compass to View Data in an Atlas Cluster
How to Connect to Your Atlas Cluster from Python
How to Connect to Your Atlas Cluster from Python
Filtering on Scalar Fields ($match, find(), and Compass)

week_data.title: Week 2
video: Querying for Documents on an Array Field

title: Applying Machine Learning to your Data with GCP
course_info:
About this course: Want to know how to query and process petabytes of data in seconds? Curious about data analysis that scales automatically as your data grows? Welcome to the Data Insights course!

This 1-week, accelerated online course teaches participants how to derive insights through data analysis and visualization using the Google Cloud Platform. The course features interactive scenarios and hands-on labs where participants explore, mine, load, visualize, and extract insights from diverse Google BigQuery datasets. The course covers data loading, querying, schema modeling, optimizing performance, query pricing,  and data visualization.

PREREQUISITES
To get the most out of this course, participants must complete the prior courses in this specialization:
• Exploring and Preparing your Data
• Storing and Visualizing your Data
• Architecture and Performance
target_audience:
Who is this class for: • Data Analysts, Business Analysts, Business Intelligence professionals
• Cloud Data Engineers who will be partnering with Data Analysts to build scalable data solutions on Google Cloud Platform
package_name: From Data to Insights with Google Cloud Platform Specialization

title: Exploring ​and ​Preparing ​your ​Data with BigQuery
course_info:
About this course: Welcome to the Coursera specialization, From Data to Insights with Google Cloud Platform brought to you by the Google Cloud team. I’m Evan Jones (a data enthusiast) and I’m going to be your guide.

This first course in this specialization is Exploring and Preparing your Data. Here we will see what the common challenges faced by data analysts are and how to solve them with the big data tools on Google Cloud Platform. You’ll pick up some SQL along the way and become very familiar with using BigQuery and Cloud Dataprep to analyze and transform your datasets.
target_audience:
Who is this class for: This is course is primarily aimed at new Data ​Analysts, ​Business ​Analysts, and Business ​Intelligence ​professionals. It is also intended for Cloud ​Data ​Engineers ​who ​will ​be partnering ​with ​Data ​Analysts ​to ​build scalable ​data ​solutions ​on ​Google Cloud ​Platform.

Note that this first course has a module on SQL basics that will be serve as a review for those already familiar with the language.
package_name: From Data to Insights with Google Cloud Platform Specialization

title: Creating New BigQuery Datasets and Visualizing Insights
course_info:
About this course: This is the second course in the Data to Insights specialization. Here we will cover how to ingest new external datasets into BigQuery and  visualize them with Google Data Studio. We will also cover intermediate SQL concepts like multi-table JOINs and UNIONs which will allow you to analyze data across multiple data sources.

Note: Even if you have a background in SQL there are BigQuery specifics (like handling query cache and table wildcards) that may be new to you.
target_audience: Who is this class for: This is course is primarily aimed at new Data ​Analysts, ​Business ​Analysts, and Business ​Intelligence ​professionals. It is also intended for Cloud ​Data ​Engineers ​who ​will ​be partnering ​with ​Data ​Analysts ​to ​build scalable ​data ​solutions ​on ​Google Cloud ​Platform.
package_name: From Data to Insights with Google Cloud Platform Specialization

week_data.title: Module 6: Storing and Exporting Data
week_data.description: Create new permanent and temporary tables from your query results

week_data.title: Module 7: Ingesting New Datasets into Google BigQuery
week_data.description: Load and create new datasets inside BigQuery
video: Lab 6: Ingesting and Querying New Datasets

week_data.title: Module 8: Data Visualization
week_data.description: Compare data visualizations and learn how to use Google Data Studio
video: Lab 7: Exploring a Dataset in Google Data Studio

week_data.title: Module 9: Joining and Merging Datasets
week_data.description: Understand the differences between SQL JOINs and UNIONs and when to use each
video: Introducing BigQuery Table Wildcards for Easy Merges

title: Achieving Advanced Insights with BigQuery
course_info:
About this course: The third course in this specialization is Achieving Advanced Insights with BigQuery. Here we will build on your growing knowledge of SQL as we dive into advanced functions and how to break apart a complex query into manageable steps. 

We will cover the internal architecture of BigQuery (column-based sharded storage) and advanced SQL topics like nested and repeated fields through the use of Arrays and Structs. Lastly we will dive into optimizing your queries for performance and how you can secure your data through authorized views.
target_audience: Who is this class for: This is course is primarily aimed at new Data ​Analysts, ​Business ​Analysts, and Business ​Intelligence ​professionals. It is also intended for Cloud ​Data ​Engineers ​who ​will ​be partnering ​with ​Data ​Analysts ​to ​build scalable ​data ​solutions ​on ​Google Cloud ​Platform.
package_name: From Data to Insights with Google Cloud Platform Specialization

week_data.title: Module 10: Advanced Functions and Clauses
week_data.description: Deepen your knowledge of SQL on BigQuery by learning about more advanced functions like statistical approximations, analytical window queries, user-defined functions, and WITH clauses.
video: Lab 9: Deriving Insights from Advanced SQL Functions

week_data.title: Module 11: Schema Design and Nested Data Structures
week_data.description: Walkthrough the evolution of how traditional databases handle dataset scale and compare how BigQuery was developed to address scaling limitations. Deep dive into nested and repeated fields which are a key part of denormalized BigQuery data structures.
video: Working with Arrays and Structs in BigQuery
BigQuery Standard SQL vs Legacy SQL
Practicing SQL on Repeated Fields in BigQuery
Lab 10: Practice Querying Nested and Repeated Fields

week_data.title: Module 12: More Visualization with Google Data Studio
week_data.description: Dive deeper into advanced visualization topics like dashboard calculated fields, filters, multi-page reports, and dashboard cache.
video: Advanced Data Studio: Case Statements and Filters
Sharing Dashboards and Data Access Pitfalls

week_data.title: Module 13: Optimizing for Performance
week_data.description: Learn the fundamental pieces of work that impact BigQuery performance and how to optimize your queries for speed.
video: Diagnose Performance Issues with the Query Explanation map
Lab 11: Optimizing and Troubleshooting Query Performance

week_data.title: Module 14: Advanced Insights with Cloud Datalab
week_data.description: Introducing Cloud Datalab -- a key tool in the Data Scientist toolkit -- which enables analysts to collaborate through the use of scalable cloud notebooks.

week_data.title: Module 15: Data Access
week_data.description: Securing and sharing your BigQuery datasets is critical for any organization. Learn what Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery tools are available to you to permission control and share your data.
video: Data Access Roles, Creating Authorized Views, and Common Pitfalls

week_data.title: Completion
week_data.description: Congratulations! You have made it to the end (or rather the beginning) of your data analyst journey. Learn what recommended resources are available to you for continued training.
